Sentencas: In the development of fuel cells, electrochemical models, describing the losses in the cell, are required for simulations on electrode to system level.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: Models considering the physicochemical background of the loss pro-cesses in the cell enable not only a gross performance prediction but also provide information about internal states, which is required in cell or stack development, evaluation of operating strategies and system control.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: The parameterization of such models is challenging as a larger number of parameters has to be determined for the considered cell.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work an impedance-based approach, successfully applied for Solid Oxide Cells, is transferred to Polymer Electrolyte Membrane Fuel Cells.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: Impedance spectra are measured over a wide range of operating conditions and subsequently analyzed by their distribution of relaxation times (DRT) to establish a physicochemically mean-ingful equivalent circuit model.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: Parameters from this model are transferred to a nonlinear 0-dimensional cell performance model that simulates the different loss contributions and calculates CV-characteristics for arbitrary operating conditions by an OCV minus losses approach.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: The straightforward application of the SOC-modeling approach to PEMFC revealed a number of hurdles successfully resolved in this paper.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: Validation with experimental data showed a good agreement over a wide range of operating conditions.
Titulo: Impedance based performance model for polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells
